column1: Your role
As a data scientist your main responsibilities will involve work collaboratively on building models and analyses to support internal products or the business’s decision processes
column2: producing code and experiments that be reproducible and maintainable as well as informing the group’s digital strategy.

column1: What does that mean in practice?

It means that over the course of just a few months you may be testing computer vision models to assess the damage of a car accident from a photo; you may be tasked with detecting faulty instruments on a factory floor from the data produced by IoT sensors; you may be processing logs to profile web users; or employ large language models to search for concepts through thousands of risk assessment reports
column2: or optimize the condition offerings in our policies. If you thought that the reach of a data scientist within an insurance company would be limited

column1: Nor should the value that a skilled data scientist can bring be confined to the technical realm! You’ll have the chance to advise core teams with global reach on their digitalization strategy
column2: shape the Group’s AI ethics policies or be involved in every part of the development of a product: from design
column3: to implementation to its financial assessment.

column1: 150 years after its foundation
column2: Zurich is still growing and so will your possibilities within it.

column1: Your Skills And Experience

You may have experience building risk scoring models in a bank or studying behavioural patterns in social psychology trials. Perhaps in your free time you have analysed smart contract transaction patterns on crypto platforms. Or you were once asked to optimise the routing of logistical services or the hourly rental price of courts in a tennis club. Maybe during your studies you spent time filtering the massive amount of data produced by particle physics experiments and you now recall with fondness long
column2: late night conversations around the interpretation of p-values. You may have built a system to detect unconscious decision patterns in a corpus of court sentences. It could be that you got tired of always getting the same recommendations on your music streaming platform and tried to reverse-engineer their algorithm. Perhaps you’ve wondered how to use mobile phone signal data to design new bus routes or study how crowds move to optimize the floor layout of a department store.

Stuart (DPD Group) is a sustainable 🌱 last-mile logistics company that connects retailers and e-merchants to a fleet of geolocalised couriers across several countries in Europe.
Our Mission 🚀
We are an impact-driven company that aims to build the future of logistics for a more sustainable world: shared

column1: About The Data Science Team 🌟

You will join our Data Science team to develop algorithm-driven solutions for all business- and operations-related challenges at Stuart in order to scale our operations in Europe. Your focus will be to participate in the research on new algorithms and methods to address topics that are both pain and gain for Stuart’s Business and Operations’ teams such as:

Demand & supply forecast: how many packages need to be delivered at any time and zone? and how many drivers are available at that time and zone? Incentive optimization: how can we move the driver to high-demand zones while staying profitable? Real-time fraud detection & prevention: how can we detect drivers rigging the system & call them out while doing so? Ride acceptance prediction: how likely is it that a driver is in for the ride? Driver lifetime value: how long and regularly will a driver work for us? Client churn: do our clients still love us? And plenty more ...

We seek to develop and deliver machine learning services to enable making better business decisions and to provide operational smoothness. Our work is always a team effort where we analyze the conditions and boundaries together with business and operations’ stakeholders and implement high-performance & robust products together with our Platform & Data engineering teams. Our ultimate goal is to understand the business
column2: determine the limits of state-of-the-art solutions

column1: About The Data Science Team 🌟

You will join our Data Science team to develop algorithm-driven solutions for all business- and operations-related challenges at Stuart in order to scale our operations in Europe. Your focus will be to participate in the research on new algorithms and methods to address topics that are both pain and gain for Stuart’s Business and Operations’ teams such as:

Demand & supply forecast: how many packages need to be delivered at any time and zone? and how many drivers are available at that time and zone? Incentive optimization: how can we move the driver to high-demand zones while staying profitable? Real-time fraud detection & prevention: how can we detect drivers rigging the system & call them out while doing so? Ride acceptance prediction: how likely is it that a driver is in for the ride? Driver lifetime value: how long and regularly will a driver work for us? Client churn: do our clients still love us? And plenty more ...

We seek to develop and deliver machine learning services to enable making better business decisions and to provide operational smoothness. Our work is always a team effort where we analyze the conditions and boundaries together with business and operations’ stakeholders and implement high-performance & robust products together with our Platform & Data engineering teams. Our ultimate goal is to understand the business
